docs.snippet: The Mets have signed Andrew Brown, who batted .232 with 5 home runs in 46 games for the Colorado Rockies last season, to a minor league contract and invited him to spring training....
docs.abstract: The Mets have signed Andrew Brown, who batted .232 with 5 home runs in 46 games for the Colorado Rockies last season, to a minor league contract and invited him to spring training.

headline.main: Mets Sign Outfielder to Minor League Deal

docs.snippet: Sam Khalifa, a shortstop for the Pirates in the ’80s, waited more than two decades for justice in the murder of his father, Rashad, who was stabbed to death at his Tucson mosque....
docs.lead_paragraph: Sam Khalifa, a shortstop for the Pirates in the ’80s, waited more than two decades for justice in the murder of his father, Rashad, who was stabbed to death at his Tucson mosque.
docs.abstract: Profile of Sam Khalifa, shortstop for Pittsburgh Pirates in the 1980s, who waited more than two decades for justice in the murder of his father, Rashad, who was stabbed to death at his Tucson mosque; Tucson received grant in 2006 to do new DNA tests from the crime scene that led to the arrest of Glen Francis.

headline.seo: Sam Khalifa: Briefly a Rising Star, Forever a Mourning Son
headline.main: Briefly a Rising Star, Forever a Mourning Son
headline.print_headline: Briefly a Rising Star, Forever a Mourning Son

docs.snippet: Major League Soccer Commissioner Don Garber said Wednesday that he was "surprised" by the recent criticism of the league by FIFA's president, Sepp Blatter....
docs.abstract: Major League Soccer Commissioner Don Garber said Wednesday that he was "surprised" by the recent criticism of the league by FIFA's president, Sepp Blatter.

headline.main: Garber 'Surprised' by Blatter's Criticism of M.L.S.
headline.print_headline: Surprised by Criticism From FIFA, M.L.S. Commissioner Cites Progress

docs.snippet: Steel used in the Brooklyn arena was supposed to be installed with much stronger bolts than were used, prompting safety concerns and the replacement of many of them since it opened in September....
docs.lead_paragraph: Steel used in the Brooklyn arena was supposed to be installed with much stronger bolts than were used, prompting safety concerns and the replacement of many of them since it opened in September.
docs.abstract: Engineers are replacing hundreds of weak steel bolts used in the construction of Brooklyn's Barclays Center; issue was discovered only one month before the arena's opening, prompting concerns about safety and communications between New York City Buildings Dept and Forest City Ratner, the site's developer.

headline.seo: Weak Bolts Have Complicated the Barclays Center’s Early Days
headline.main: Problem With Weak Bolts Has Complicated the Barclays Center’s Early Days
headline.print_headline: Problem With Weak Bolts Has Complicated the Barclays Center’s Early Days
